channel.title: A Bit of Help [Java Compiler]
channel.description: Hello, I've recently been working on learning Java the only thing I really need help with is finding a compiler.. I have JDK 6 Update 10.. not sure if you needed to know that honestly.. if you need any more information to help me find a working compiler just ask I will be glad to tell.

item.title: A Bit of Help [Java Compiler]
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“f 2 p 2 p f, post:8, topic:205774”]Simply make a notepad file called cmdline.bat in the folder where you’re java files are that need compiling then

cmd
pause

Paste that into it and save

and double click on it if it comes up with a black box type lets say the java file name is Jackpot

type
javac Jackpot.java
remmember its case sensitive.[/quote]
Just put

@echo off "Path or javac" *.java pause

Read full topic

item.title: A Bit of Help [Java Compiler]
item.dc:creator: @f_2_p_2_p_f f 2 p 2 p f
item.description:
@f_2_p_2_p_f wrote:

Simply make a notepad file called cmdline.bat in the folder where you’re java files are that need compiling then

cmd
pause

Paste that into it and save

and double click on it if it comes up with a black box type lets say the java file name is Jackpot

type
javac Jackpot.java
remmember its case sensitive.

Read full topic

item.title: A Bit of Help [Java Compiler]
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

javac -cp . filename.java

cd to your directory in the prompt first.

Read full topic

item.title: A Bit of Help [Java Compiler]
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:4, topic:205774”]eclipse

Good IDE if you want something simple, it will compile for you, and also inform you of errors before it compiles…[/quote]Actually, Eclipse compiles your current source (but ONLY your open class that you’re editing) when you save or are inactive for a few seconds (atleast what I think). That is how it generates its compiliation errors. There’s that reason (most likely), as I really doubt they were in the mood to build their own Java compiler for simple IDE reasons.

Read full topic

item.title: A Bit of Help [Java Compiler]
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

Get_Forgotten:

How would i run the compiler that came with Java? My friend told me that it came with one but he isn’t here to help me right now.

in the cmd type cd locationofjavafilehere

then type javac classfilename.java

Read full topic

item.title: A Bit of Help [Java Compiler]
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

eclipse

Good IDE if you want something simple, it will compile for you, and also inform you of errors before it compiles…

Read full topic

item.title: A Bit of Help [Java Compiler]
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

java comes with one, it is javac, you run it from the command line

I prefer to use the compiler in an IDE such as eclipse.

Read full topic
